description: Students examine a major period of German history and its impact on the institutional, intellectual,
and artistic heritage of Europe. Course involves close reading and analysis of primary sources
as well as critical evaluations of the period and focus on history as an interpretive reconstruction
of the past.  Sample periods include: the Reformation, Weimar Classicism, the German revolution
of 1848, German modernism and post-holocaust Germany. Taught in German with strategies for writing
term papers in German.  Prerequisite: German 251 or German 252.  May be repeated if topic is
